context: Beyond this, BYU also runs a very large study abroad program, with <b5_0>satellite centers<b5_0/> in London, Jerusalem, and Paris, as well as more than 20 other sites. <a0_0>Nearly 2,000<a0_0/> students take advantage of these programs yearly. In 2001, the <b6_0>Institute of International Education<b6_0/> ranked BYU as the <a1_0>number one<a1_0/> university in the U.S. to offer students study abroad opportunities. <b8_0>The <a2_0><b7_0>BYU Jerusalem Center<b8_0/><a2_0/>,<b7_0/> which was closed in 2000 due to student security concerns related to the Second Intifada and, more recently, the <a4_0>2006 Israel-Lebanon conflict<a4_0/>, was reopened to students in the <a3_0><b9_0>Winter<b9_0/> 2007 semester<a3_0/>.
